entry.title: Apache HTTP Server SSLè¯ä¹¦éªŒè¯ç»•è¿‡æ¼æ´
entry.content:
æ¼æ´ä¿¡æ¯

æ¼æ´åç§°ï¼š Apache HTTP Server SSLè¯ä¹¦éªŒè¯ç»•è¿‡æ¼æ´

æ¼æ´ç¼–å·ï¼š

  • CVEï¼š CVE-2024-40898

æ¼æ´ç±»å‹ï¼š é…ç½®é—®é¢˜

æ¼æ´ç­‰çº§ï¼š é«˜å±

æ¼æ´æè¿°ï¼š CVE-2024-40898æ˜¯Apache HTTP Serverä¸­çš„ä¸€ä¸ªå®‰å…¨æ¼æ´ï¼Œå…è®¸æ”»å‡»è€…åœ¨ç‰¹å®šæ¡ä»¶ä¸‹ç»•è¿‡SSLè¯ä¹¦éªŒè¯ï¼Œå¯èƒ½å¯¼è‡´TLSä¸Šçš„ä¸­é—´äººæ”»å‡»(MitM)ã€‚æ­¤Pythonè„šæœ¬æ˜¯ä¸€ä¸ªæ¦‚å¿µéªŒè¯(PoC)æ‰«æå™¨ï¼Œç”¨äºæ£€æµ‹è¯¥æ¼æ´ã€‚

äº§å“å‚å•†ï¼š Apache

äº§å“åç§°ï¼š Apache HTTP Server

æ¥æºï¼š https://github.com/ForceEA001/CVE-2024-40898-SSL-Bypass-Detection

ç±»å‹ï¼š CVE-2024:github search

ä»“åº“æ–‡ä»¶

  • .gitignore
  • CVE-2024-40898-SSL-Bypass-Detection
  • LICENSE
  • README.md
  • check_cve_40898.py

æ¥æºæ¦‚è¿°

CVE-2024-40898 SSL Certificate Validation Bypass Scanner

This repository contains a Python-based proof-of-concept (PoC) script to detect CVE-2024-40898, a vulnerability in Apache HTTP Server that allows attackers to bypass SSL certificate verification.

Overview

CVE-2024-40898 is a security issue in Apache HTTP Server which, under certain conditions, permits clients to bypass certificate validation. This can potentially allow man-in-the-middle (MitM) attacks over TLS.

What this script does

  • Reads a list of host:port pairs from ssl-ports.txt.
  • For each entry:
    • Establishes a TLS connection using a custom SSL context that disables certificate validation.
    • Sends a HEAD / request to the server.
    • Examines the response:
      • If the response includes 200 OK, the target is considered potentially vulnerable.
      • If no such response is returned, the target is marked as safe.
      • If any exception occurs during connection, the result is recorded as an error.

Requirements

  • Python 3.x

How to Use

  1. Prepare your ssl-ports.txt file with a list of targets, one per line, in the format:
    domain.com:443
    example.org:443
    1. Run the script:

python3 check_cve_40898.py
3.The output will label each domain as:
â€¢[VULNERABLE] â€“ possible certificate validation bypass
â€¢[SAFE] â€“ no issue detected
â€¢[ERROR] â€“ failed connection or SSL error
Disclaimer

This tool is provided for educational and testing purposes only. Ensure you have permission to scan the listed domains. The author is not responsible for any misuse of this code.

License

This project is licensed under the MIT License.

entry.title: PostgreSQL libpq SQLæ³¨å…¥æ¼æ´
entry.content:
æ¼æ´ä¿¡æ¯

æ¼æ´åç§°ï¼š PostgreSQL libpq SQLæ³¨å…¥æ¼æ´

æ¼æ´ç¼–å·ï¼š

  • CVEï¼š CVE-2025-1094

æ¼æ´ç±»å‹ï¼š SQLæ³¨å…¥

æ¼æ´ç­‰çº§ï¼š é«˜å±

æ¼æ´æè¿°ï¼š PostgreSQL libpqä¸­çš„å‡½æ•°PQescapeLiteral()ã€PQescapeIdentifier()ã€PQescapeString()å’ŒPQescapeStringConn()å¯¹å¼•ç”¨è¯­æ³•çš„å¤„ç†ä¸å½“ï¼Œå…è®¸æ•°æ®åº“è¾“å…¥æä¾›è€…åœ¨æŸäº›ä½¿ç”¨æ¨¡å¼ä¸‹å®ç°SQLæ³¨å…¥ã€‚å…·ä½“æ¥è¯´ï¼ŒSQLæ³¨å…¥è¦æ±‚åº”ç”¨ç¨‹åºä½¿ç”¨å‡½æ•°ç»“æœæ„é€ psqlï¼ˆPostgreSQLäº¤äº’å¼ç»ˆç«¯ï¼‰çš„è¾“å…¥ã€‚ç±»ä¼¼åœ°ï¼ŒPostgreSQLå‘½ä»¤è¡Œå®ç”¨ç¨‹åºä¸­çš„å¼•ç”¨è¯­æ³•å¤„ç†ä¸å½“ï¼Œå½“client_encodingä¸ºBIG5ä¸”server_encodingä¸ºEUC_TWæˆ–MULE_INTERNALæ—¶ï¼Œå…è®¸å‘½ä»¤è¡Œå‚æ•°æºå®ç°SQLæ³¨å…¥ã€‚PostgreSQL 17.3ã€16.7ã€15.11ã€14.16å’Œ13.19ä¹‹å‰çš„ç‰ˆæœ¬å—å½±å“ã€‚

äº§å“å‚å•†ï¼š PostgreSQL

äº§å“åç§°ï¼š PostgreSQL libpq

å½±å“ç‰ˆæœ¬ï¼š version < 13.19, 14.16, 15.11, 16.7, 17.3

æ¥æºï¼š https://github.com/rapid7/metasploit-framework/issues/20363

ç±»å‹ï¼š rapid7/metasploit-framework:github issues

æ¥æºæ¦‚è¿°

Summary

Improper neutralization of quoting syntax in PostgreSQL libpq functions PQescapeLiteral(), PQescapeIdentifier(), PQescapeString(), and PQescapeStringConn() allows a database input provider to achieve SQL injection in certain usage patterns. Specifically, SQL injection requires the application to use the function result to construct input to psql, the PostgreSQL interactive terminal. Similarly, improper neutralization of quoting syntax in PostgreSQL command line utility programs allows a source of command line arguments to achieve SQL injection when client_encoding is BIG5 and server_encoding is one of EUC_TW or MULE_INTERNAL. Versions before PostgreSQL 17.3, 16.7, 15.11, 14.16, and 13.19 are affected.
[Summary was taken from NVD]

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/cve-2025-1094
  • https://access.redhat.com/security/cve/cve-2025-1094
  • https://www.rapid7.com/blog/post/2025/02/13/cve-2025-1094-postgresql-psql-sql-injection-fixed/

æ¼æ´ç­‰çº§ï¼š é«˜å±

æ¼æ´æè¿°ï¼š ProFTPD 1.3.5ç‰ˆæœ¬ä¸­çš„mod_copyæ¨¡å—å­˜åœ¨å‘½ä»¤æ‰§è¡Œæ¼æ´ï¼Œæ”»å‡»è€…å¯ä»¥åˆ©ç”¨æ­¤æ¼æ´åœ¨ç›®æ ‡ç³»ç»Ÿä¸Šæ‰§è¡Œä»»æ„å‘½ä»¤ã€‚

ç±»å‹ï¼š rapid7/metasploit-framework:github issues

æ¥æºæ¦‚è¿°

Steps to reproduce

Howâ€™d you do it?

  1. get virtualbox ubuntu 24.04
  2. get meterpreter (i installed as shown on site via shell)
  3. run unix/ftp/proftpd_modcopy_exec on appropriate target

target has Linux, ProFTPD 1.3.5 on port 21, OpenSSH 7.6p1 Ubuntu 4ubuntu0.7 (Ubuntu Linux; protocol 2.0) on port 22, Linux telnetd on port 23, Apache httpd 2.4.29 on port 80

Were you following a specific guide/tutorial or reading documentation?

documentation based experience

Expected behavior

upon successful execution, attack should open meterpreter â€œwindowâ€ (iâ€™d call it session but it clearly does open session, just doesnâ€™t allow me to type anything in)

Current behavior

payload successfully executes, i get â€œmeterpreter session openedâ€ and no actual option to use meterpreter

Metasploit version

6.4.55~20250326102656~1rapid7-1

entry.content:

æ¼æ´åç§°ï¼š Sophos XG Firewall SQLæ³¨å…¥æ¼æ´

æ¼æ´ç¼–å·ï¼š

  • CVEï¼š CVE-2020-12271

æ¼æ´ç±»å‹ï¼š SQLæ³¨å…¥

æ¼æ´ç­‰çº§ï¼š ä¸¥é‡

æ¼æ´æè¿°ï¼š åœ¨Sophos XG Firewallè®¾å¤‡çš„SFOS 17.0ã€17.1ã€17.5å’Œ18.0ç‰ˆæœ¬ä¸­ï¼Œå‘ç°äº†ä¸€ä¸ªSQLæ³¨å…¥é—®é¢˜ï¼Œæ­¤é—®é¢˜åœ¨2020å¹´4æœˆè¢«é‡å¤–åˆ©ç”¨ã€‚å½±å“é…ç½®äº†ç®¡ç†ï¼ˆHTTPSï¼‰æœåŠ¡æˆ–åœ¨WANåŒºåŸŸæš´éœ²ç”¨æˆ·é—¨æˆ·çš„è®¾å¤‡ã€‚æˆåŠŸçš„æ”»å‡»å¯èƒ½å¯¼è‡´è¿œç¨‹ä»£ç æ‰§è¡Œï¼Œæ³„éœ²æœ¬åœ°è®¾å¤‡ç®¡ç†å‘˜ã€é—¨æˆ·ç®¡ç†å‘˜å’Œç”¨äºè¿œç¨‹è®¿é—®çš„ç”¨æˆ·è´¦æˆ·çš„ç”¨æˆ·åå’Œå“ˆå¸Œå¯†ç ï¼ˆä½†ä¸åŒ…æ‹¬å¤–éƒ¨Active Directoryæˆ–LDAPå¯†ç ï¼‰ã€‚

äº§å“å‚å•†ï¼š Sophos

äº§å“åç§°ï¼š Sophos XG Firewall

å½±å“ç‰ˆæœ¬ï¼š 17.0, 17.1, 17.5, 18.0 before 2020-04-25

æœç´¢è¯­æ³•ï¼š http.title:â€sophosâ€

æ¥æºï¼š https://github.com/projectdiscovery/nuclei-templates/issues/12499

ç±»å‹ï¼š projectdiscovery/nuclei-templates:github issues

æ¥æºæ¦‚è¿°

Description:

A SQL injection issue was found in SFOS 17.0, 17.1, 17.5, and 18.0 before 2020-04-25 on Sophos XG Firewall devices, as exploited in the wild in April 2020. This affected devices configured with either the administration (HTTPS) service or the User Portal exposed on the WAN zone. A successful attack may have caused remote code execution that exfiltrated usernames and hashed passwords for the local device admin(s), portal admins, and user accounts used for remote access (but not external Active Directory or LDAP passwords)

Severity: Critical
POC:
  • https://news.sophos.com/en-us/2020/04/26/asnarok/

KEV: True

Shodan Query: http.title:"sophos"

Acceptance Criteria: The template must include a complete POC and should not rely solely on version-based detection. Contributors are required to provide debug data(-debug) along with the template to help the triage team with validation or can also share a vulnerable environment like docker file.

Rewards will only be given once the template is fully validated by the team. Templates that are incomplete or invalid will not be accepted. Avoid adding code templates for CVEs that can be achieved using HTTP, TCP, or JavaScript. Such templates are blocked by default and wonâ€™t produce results, so we prioritize creating templates with other protocols unless exceptions are made.

You can check the FAQ for the Nuclei Templates Community Rewards Program here.
